A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Rian Johnson held true to the Franchise and gave us exactly what was needed. The reveal that Rey's parentage was free of the Skywalker bloodline and born in the sands of Jakku showed us that power can come from anywhere as long as you have the heart to claim it. Luke's brooding was finally supplanted by his yoda-like acceptance of the true understanding of the Force\, thus finally elevating him to the level of mastery his legend had foisted upon him. Action\, drama\, and comedy we're all perfectly balanced in this perfect piece of the Star Wars puzzle. It felt like a true passing of the torch and makes one ravenous for future  installments.
